channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Consumers Have a Debt Problem: Not Enough of the Right Kind
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s next interest-rate decision could be a fateful one for many consumers and in turn for debates about the health of the American s...

item.title: Should individual investors join the private-equity party?
item.description: Private equity isn’t all it’s cracked up to be, a review of Wall Street research shows

item.title: Why Europe Is Embracing the New American Growth Model
item.description: Following the trail of the U.S. will require more government intervention in industrial and trade policy.

item.title: Oracle’s stock could pack 30% more upside as these investor worries fade away
item.description: Oracle’s stock is heading for its best five-day run since 2001 as an analyst said recent developments alleviate fears on margins and free cash flow.

item.title: Where to Put Your Money When the Fed Cuts Rates
item.description: What lower rates mean for the trillions of dollars in CDs and high-yield savings accounts.

item.title: Boeing’s credit rating is safe, for now, S&P says
item.description: While Moody’s Ratings placed the credit on review for a possible downgrade Friday on fears the strike will put more pressure on free cash flow, and Fi...

item.title: Why Washington and Big Oil Are Investing Billions in Ammonia
item.description: The latest bet is a $1.56 billion Energy Department loan commitment for a Wabash Valley Resources ammonia project in Indiana.

item.title: The Fed rate cut could help home buyers solve one of their biggest problems
item.description: Falling mortgage rates could ease the ‘lock-in effect’ that’s put a chill on the housing market.

item.title: Bajaj Housing Finance Shares Surge After India's Biggest IPO This Year
item.description: The mortgage lender’s shares surged on their debut, reaffirming growing investor enthusiasm for one of the best-performing stock markets in the world.

item.title: Zillow’s stock surges after analyst says start buying as mortgage rates fall
